titleInfo.title: Letter from James Pringle Riach, Acting Resident, Bushire to Captain Thomas Elwon, the Honourable Company's Cruiser (HCC) Antelope

mods.abstract: Riach instructs Elwon to proceed to Bahrine [Bahrain] to investigate the seizure of several boats belonging to Bedda by people under the authority of Sheikh Tannoon [Ṭaḥnūn bin Shakhbūṭ Āl Nahyān, Ruler of Sharjah], who had previously reported the seizure of ten of his pearl boats by a subject of his, Soueedaun been Zal [Sūwaydān bin Za‘al], who had been allowed to settle at Bedda under the authority of Sheikh Abdoola been Ahmed [‘Abdullāh bin Aḥmad Āl Khalīfah, Ruler of Bahrain]. Riach asks Elwon to find out who the first aggressor was, and then to proceed to Abothebee [Abu Dhabi] to make further enquiries. The sheikhs were to be reminded that no retaliation to an act of aggression was permitted to any member of the pacified tribes without first referring the matter to the British authorities.
